ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic triad of intellectual disability, delayed speech/language, and ADHD. Most common inherited cause of intellectual disability in males.
Frequently presents with intellectual disability, speech delays, and ADHD as part of the neurodevelopmental phenotype.
Common microdeletion syndrome with intellectual disability, speech delays, and high rates of ADHD.
XXY syndrome in males often presents with mild intellectual disability, language delays, and attention problems.
Characterized by mild intellectual disability, delayed language (despite relative verbal strengths later), and ADHD.
Overgrowth syndrome with intellectual disability, speech delays, and behavioral issues including ADHD.
Presents with intellectual disability and speech delays; behavioral problems including hyperactivity are common.
X-linked condition affecting males with intellectual disability, severe speech delays, and hyperactive behavior.
